questions.text: Identify the wrong statement regarding the given image?

options.label: C
options.text: Multiple nodules within scarring and interconnecting bridges

options.label: D
options.text: It is known as Fox Fordyce disease

questions.correct_answer: D. It is known as Fox Fordyce disease

questions.text: An 18-year-old woman presents with a fever and headache. She also complains of vaginal itching and dysuria. When asked, she says that she recently became sexually active. Physical examination reveals tender inguinal lymphadenopathy and red, pustular, painful vesicles on her labia majora. What is the most likely diagnosis?
questions.explanation:
CHARACTERISTIC SYPHILIS HERPES CHANCROID LGV DONOVANOSIS
Primary lesion Papule Vesicle Pustule Papule, vesicle pustule Papule
Number of lesions Usually 1 Multiple Multiple Single Variable
Diameter 5-15 mm 1-2 mm Variable 2-10 mm Variable
Edges Sharply demarcated elevated Erythematous Polycyclic Undermined Ragged Elevated Round or oval Elevated Irregular
Depth Superficial or deep Superficial Excavated Superficial Or deep Elevated
Base Smooth Non-purulent Covered with serous exudate Erythematous Purulent Dirty grey Base Variable Red Velvety Bleeds easily
Induration Buttonhole None not indurated not indurated not indurated
Lymphadenopathy Shotty lymph nodes Palpable tender Large inflamed bubo Bubos - inflammatory No lymphadenopathy.
Pain Painless Painful Painful Bubos - tender Painless

questions.text: Which of the following statements are true about Type I lepra reactions? It is a type III hypersensitivity reaction Steroids are the drug of choice Clinical features include nodules over skin, arthritis, and orchitis. It consists of Borderline tubercular (BT), Borderline Borderline (BB), and Borderline lepromatous type.
questions.explanation:
LEPRA REACTION
Type I / reversal reaction Type II / ENL reaction
1. Hypersensitivity IV II
2. Leprosy Borderline tubercular (BT) Borderline borderline (BB)Borderline Lepromatous (BL) Borderline Lepromatous (BL)Lepromatous Lepromatous (LL)
3. Clinical features New lesions are absent (edema, neuritis are present)

New lesions develop

  • Nodules over skin Erythema nodosum leprosum (ENL)
  • Arthritis
  • Orchitis
  • Iridocyclitis
4. Inflammatory mediators IL-1, 2 IFN-y TNF-aQ IL- 4,5
5. Drug of choice Steroids Steroids
Prednisolone
1mg /kg/bwt & then gradually tapered every 2 weeks

questions.text: A patient came in with erythematous plaques with silvery-white scaling. On rubbing and removing these scales we see pinpoint bleeding spots. Which of the following medication cannot be used topically for this patient?

A newborn baby was exposed to a cold environment. Non-shivering thermogenesis is normally used by them to prevent hypothermia. What is the post-mortem finding in this patient if this mechanism fails to work?

options.label: A
options.text: PM hypostasis is Pale in color

options.label: C
options.text: Mucosal Haemorrhages are seen in the stomach

questions.correct_answer: C. Mucosal Haemorrhages are seen in the stomach

questions.text: A 14-year-old girl working in a bar was raped by a gang of 3 men. She became pregnant and was diagnosed with HIV. What is the legal section for punishment in this case for the rapists?
Date rape drugs include all of the following, except?

A primigravida mother gives birth to a newborn. Safety precautions were followed properly and the umbilical cord was clamped. When can we expect the inflammatory ring around the umbilical cord after birth?

A 35-year-old female presented with headache, pallor, and fever for the past two days. The patient addressed that despite taking tablets for fever, the temperature did not decrease to normal. Upon examination, swelling over the mastoid surface was noted. The doctor used an ophthalmoscope and checked for bulging of retinal veins while simultaneously pressing the Internal jugular vein of the ipsilateral side. What is this method known as?

A patient appeared for cleaning her ear for impacted cerumen. The intern performed the cleaning and during the process, he accidentally injured the posterior half in the lateral side of the tympanic membrane. What is the nerve supply to the damaged area?
Which is of the following differentiates an antrochoanal polyp with an ethmoidal polyp?

options.label: A
options.text: AC polyps are small, multiple and bilateral

options.label: C
options.text: It comes out anteriorly from the anterior nares

options.label: D
options.text: It is common in adults with allergy

questions.explanation:
ANTROCHOANAL POLYP (AC Polyp) ETHMOIDAL POLYP
  • Starts from maxillary antrum
  • Starts from ethmoidal air cells from anterior nares
  • Single, large, U/L
  • Small, multiple, B/L
  • Grows posteriorly towards choana
  • Comes out anteriorly
  • Children with an infection
  • Adults with allergy
  • C/F : Both U/L and B/L obstruction
  • B/L Nasal obstruction

questions.text: What is the paranasal sinus seen best in this X-ray view?

A 2-year-old boy was brought to the OPD with complaints of increased stridor while crying. The same improves when the patient is in a prone position. The doctor wanted to examine the patient using a laryngoscope. Which of the following structures is not seen in an indirect laryngoscope?
questions.explanation:
Indirect Laryngoscopy Direct Laryngoscopy
Image: Virtual, Smaller, Inverted Actual larynx
Ease of ProcedureCan be done in OPD Requires OT
PhonationPossible(vocal fold movement can be seen) Not possible(movement cannot be seen)
Patient CooperationRequired(cannot be done in Children) Not required(can be done)
Additional Procedures (Biopsy)Cannot be done Can be done
Hidden areasNot seen Seen

questions.text: A patient with a prior history of pulmonary tuberculosis has developed submucosal nodules in the posterior larynx. What is the first sign to diagnose laryngeal tuberculosis?

options.label: D
options.text: Mouse nibbled appearance of vocal folds

questions.correct_answer: B. Incomplete adduction of vocal folds

questions.text: A 20-month-old male infant was brought by his mother for fall injury with abrasions on both knees. During the examination, the doctor inspected several injuries in different areas of the body and had disparency between history and physical examination findings. A differential diagnosis of Caffey syndrome was made. What is the most consistent component of the triad of injuries in this condition?
A police officer recovered a burnt body accidentally and requested for an autopsy report of the victim. Which of the following features will confirm the body as a male using the skeleton?
questions.explanation:
Male Female
1. Muscle marking ridges More prominent Less prominent EXCEPTION:Frontal parietal eminence- more in females
2. Index Sciatic notch Ischiopubic (Washburn)Sternal index Less More
Corporo basal index More Less

Features Male Female
Architecture Rugged Smooth
Frontal Eminence Small Large
Parietal Eminence Small Large
Orbits Square with smooth margin Rounded with sharp margin
Fore Head Steeper Vertical
Palate Large, Broader & U shaped Smaller & Parabola
Occipital Condyle Large Small

questions.text: A 17-year-old male presented with profuse bleeding from the nose and obstruction. On examination, a fleshy mass was noted in the nasal cavity which started to bleed on touching. Which of the following statements is true regarding this condition?

options.label: A
options.text: This is a hypodense, spherical shaped tumor

options.label: B
options.text: Endoscopic excision is always the treatment of choice

options.label: C
options.text: Posterior bowing of anterior maxillary wall seen on CECT

questions.correct_answer: B. Endoscopic excision is always the treatment of choice

questions.text: An 7-year-old boy presented with fever, sore throat, and dysphagia for more than a week suspecting a viral infection. Upon examination, red and congested tonsils were seen. What is the diagnosis?
Which of the following statements about cornea is false?

options.label: A
options.text: Cornea is thickest in the center, thinnest in the periphery, from 500-600μ, IOP depends upon central corneal thickness

options.label: C
options.text: Most powerful refracting surface of the eye 43D

questions.correct_answer: A. Cornea is thickest in the center, thinnest in the periphery, from 500-600μ, IOP depends upon central corneal thickness

questions.text: Which of the following drugs causes the following type of cataract?
All are correct about the given instrument except?

options.label: B
options.text: Always inserted through a small pupil

options.label: D
options.text: Effective in cases of corneal opacities where femto- laser cannot act

questions.correct_answer: B. Always inserted through a small pupil

questions.text: Which of the following is the most radio-resistant structure of the eye?

A 35-year-old male patient came with history of progressive night blindness and decreased vision since childhood. Now he developed tubular vision. Retinal examination as shown below revealed jet black, spidery spots like bone corpuscles. Which of the following statement is true?

options.label: A
options.text: Most commonly inherited as X-linked recessive

options.label: B
options.text: Triad includes Attenuated vessels. optic atrophy and disc edema

options.label: C
options.text: Electrophysiological changes appear early in the disease before the objective signs

options.label: D
options.text: Argus 2 retinal implant is used as a treatment modality

questions.correct_answer: B. Triad includes Attenuated vessels. optic atrophy and disc edema

questions.text: Which of the following statement is false about chalazion? Always tender Infection of meibomian gland Malignant change to sebaceous cell carcinoma Also called a tarsal cyst Diathermy is used for marginal chalazion
Crowding phenomenon is seen in?

A 30-year-old male with no relevant past medical history presented to the hospital with severe right-sided retro-orbital pain with right-sided ptosis and diplopia. He also complained of neck stiffness but denied any symptoms of nausea or vomiting. After extensive evaluation, granulomatous inflammation of the superior orbital fissure was identified. The specific term for this condition is:
Benedict’s test is given by reducing sugar. Which of the following disaccharide will not be positive for this test?
Identify the correct statement:

options.label: A
options.text: GLUT-2 responsible for glucose and fructose absorption

options.label: B
options.text: Glucose is absorbed independent of Sodium

questions.correct_answer: D. SGLT-2 is specific for glucose
questions.explanation:
GLUT-2is only forGlucose(inthe Liver & Pancreas).
Glucoseis absorbed from the intestine by Sodiumdependentsecondary active transport.
Fructoseis absorbed byGLUT-5, whichdoes not require sodium.
SGLT-1is forGlucose&Galactoseabsorption (in intestine & renal tubules)
SGLT-2is forGlucoseabsorptiononly (in renal tubules)

Most widely distributed GLUT GLUT-1
Most abundant in RBCs GLUT-1
Major GLUT in brain and placenta GLUT-1
Major GLUT in neurons GLUT-3
Brain GLUT-1 and GLUT-3

questions.text: Which of the following is regarded as the 1st substrate of the TCA cycle?

questions.text: A 3-month-old infant presents with hepatosplenomegaly and failure to thrive. A liver biopsy reveals glycogen with an abnormal, amylopectin-like structure. Which of the following enzymes would most likely be deficient?
questions.explanation:
Enzyme deficient Disease Features
Branching enzyme Amylopectinosis
  • Stored glycogen is abnormal
  • long polysaccharide chains with few branch points
  • resembles -Amylopectin
Debranching enzyme Limit dextrinosis Limit dextrin’s (glycogen remains to have shorter linear chains with very short branch point)-accumulate
Glucose-6-phosphatase Von-Gierke’s disease Stored glycogen-Normal

questions.text: High rate of mutation in mitochondrial DNA due to which of the following? No Intron No DNA repair enzyme High H2O2 production from ETC operation

B-DNA A-DNA Z-DNA
Base pairs/turn 10 11 12
Right/left-handed Right Right Left with the zigzag sugar-phosphate backbone

questions.text: A 20-year-old alcoholic malnourished patient presented to the hospital with respiratory distress. His pulse was 112/minute. The patient had edema, hypertension, systolic murmur along the left sternal edge. Bilateral murmur along the left sternal edge. Bilateral crepitations were felt in the lungs. A diagnosis of congestive high output cardiac failure was made. Which vitamin is deficient?
Which of the given statements is incorrect?

options.label: A
options.text: Vitamin K is the only fat-soluble vitamin with coenzyme activity

options.label: B
options.text: Phylloquinone is derived from a plant source

options.label: C
options.text: Vitamin K 3 can be converted to Vitamin K 1 in liver

options.label: D
options.text: Menaquinone is synthesized by bacterial flora in the intestine

questions.correct_answer: C. Vitamin K 3 can be converted to Vitamin K 1 in liver
questions.explanation:
(K1) Phyloquinone
  • Plant source
(K2) Menaquinone
  • Animal source
  • Synthesized by bacterial flora in intestine
  • Stored in Liver
(K3) synthetic form Menadione
  • Water soluble
  • Can be converted to K2 in Liver

questions.text: All of the following statements are true regarding prenatal diagnostic techniques, except?

options.label: A
options.text: Pregnant lady is given an undertaking that she does not want to know the sex of the fetus

options.label: B
options.text: PNDT is indicated in pregnant women > 35 y.o. and 2 or more spontaneous abortions

options.label: C
options.text: Application for renewal of registration has to be made 30 days before expiry and it is valid for 10 years

options.label: D
options.text: Appropriate authority for PNDT has the power of cancellation or suspension of registration of clinic/hospital

questions.correct_answer: C. Application for renewal of registration has to be made 30 days before expiry and it is valid for 10 years

questions.text: Which among the following statements is true about the Amniotic fluid index on USG?

options.label: A

options.label: B
options.text: Normal amniotic fluid index ranges 1000-2000 ml

options.label: C
options.text: Polyhydramnios in cord and limb free pocket is >10 cm

questions.text: A G2P1 female presented to the emergency room with complaints of painless bleeding from the vagina. She is pregnant with 28 weeks AOG. On examination, a velamentous cord at Os was seen. What is the best modality for diagnosing this case?

A pregnant woman visited the OPD for a normal antenatal visit. An Ultrasound was taken. Doppler localized an Arterio-venous anastomosis. Which of the following is true regarding the possible diagnosis of this case?

options.label: A
options.text: Polyhydramnios > 8 cm liquor pocket in recipient

options.label: B
options.text: Mortality is 100% if present at or before 24 weeks AOG

options.label: C
options.text: Amnioreduction of smaller baby is done as treatment

options.label: D
options.text: Oligohydramnios < 4 cm liquor pocket in donor

questions.correct_answer: B. Mortality is 100% if present at or before 24 weeks AOG

questions.text: A pregnant lady was screened for GDM at 24 weeks of pregnancy. Glucose tolerance test with 75 grams of sugar in fasting state was 100, at 1 hour was 190 and 2 hour was 150. Which of the following can be a newborn complication?
A 27-year-old G1P0 female came for her regular antenatal check-up. As an obstetrician, you wanted to assess the uteroplacental flow of the fetus. Which among the following is the best measure for it?

A primigravida of 12 weeks AOG came for ante natal check-up. There were no complaints of pain or bleeding. On examination, Fetal heart tone was absent. USG was taken. What is the most possible diagnosis?
All of the following are true regarding the diagnosis of pregnancy using radiological equipment’s, except?

options.label: A
options.text: Cardiac activity is heard with Transabdominal sonography at 5+ weeks

options.label: B
options.text: Fetal heart sound heard with Fetal Doppler at 12 weeks

options.label: C
options.text: Gestational sac is seen with Transvaginal sonography at 4+ weeks

options.label: D
options.text: Fetal heart sound heard with Stethoscope at 24 weeks

questions.correct_answer: A. Cardiac activity is heard with Transabdominal sonography at 5+ weeks
questions.explanation:
G-SAC CARDIAC ACTIVITY
  • TVS – 4+ weeks
  • TAS – 5+ weeks
  • 5+ weeks
  • 6+ weeks

questions.text: A pregnant female experienced labor pain at 34 weeks of gestation and was brought to the labor room. All of the following can be a reason for preterm labor when diagnosed with USG, except?
questions.correct_answer: C. Funneling of cervix around 32 weeks

questions.text: A G3P3 woman delivered a term baby via normal vaginal delivery and was discharged after 2 days from the hospital. After 2 weeks of delivery, the patient developed fever, abdominal pain, fatigue, and foul-smelling discharge from the vagina. What are the best radiological modalities you will order in this patient to confirm the diagnosis?

options.label: B
options.text: Abdominal Xray and CT lower limb

options.label: C
options.text: CT scan or MRI lower limb

options.label: D
options.text: USG of Abdomen and MRI lower limb

questions.correct_answer: C. CT scan or MRI lower limb

questions.text: A patient on examination, showed Uterine tenderness, adnexal tenderness, cervical motion tenderness. Which of the following is not useful in the diagnosis of this case?

A 65-year-old female presented with complaints of mood swings and insomnia. She also developed intense heat with sweating all over her face and chest which becomes normal in a few minutes. What is the drug of choice for the later symptom?
Name the procedure indicated in the image, if the dotted line denotes the resected portion.

A 25 years old G1P1 female from a village presented to the labor room for delivery. It was noted that the patient had no antenatal visits during pregnancy. Despite having good uterine contractions, there was no progress of labor. There was minimal or no descent of presenting part. All of the following can be a cause for these features, except?
A mother of four children decided to undergo tubectomy procedure. What is the most commonly performed technique for this procedure?

A 13-year-old girl was brought by her parents complaining of the absence of menstrual onset. On examination, there was the presence of menstrual blood and a diagnosis of Cryptomenorrhea was made. All of the following can be a cause of this condition, except?

An 8-year-old boy presented with pubertal features. During a regular check-up, he was diagnosed as a case of precocious puberty and several workups were done. It was noted that the patient had deficiency of 21 hydroxylase enzyme. What is the condition present in this patient?

An 18 year old female complained of pain in the pelvis every month for the past few months. Upon evaluation, it was noted that the pain was due to collection of blood and debris in the pouch of Douglas at the time of ovulation. What is the most possible diagnosis?

A newly married couple presented with complaints of Infertility. Having no significant history causing the problem, semen analysis was performed which showed absence of sperm. Ovulation tests showed normal results. Which among the sperm extraction techniques that should be performed in this patient, is suitable to be done under general anaesthesia?

A 70 year old female presented with vulvar mass. On examination, the mass was already a significant part of lower 1/3rd of urethra. No lymph nodes were involved. What would be the treatment option for this patient?
questions.explanation:

I A

I B

Bii

questions.text: A 50 year old farmer was brought by his son to the emergency department with symptoms of dyspnea, increased sweating, lacrimation, involuntary urination. Upon examination, Miosis was noted. H.R – 54 bpm. Which of the following drug poisonings can be treated with dialysis?
An adolescent after having mushrooms for dinner, presented with sweating, bradycardia, and increased salivation. What is the next step of management in this patient?
questions.explanation:
POISONING DOC
Organophosphates & Carbamate Atropine
Atropa Belladonna /Datura Physostigmine
Early Mushroom Poisoning Atropine

MUSHROOM POISONING
Early Mushroom Poisoning Late Mushroom poisoning
  • Caused by Inocybe / Clitocybe species
  • Caused by Amanita group of species
  • Shows symptoms similar to Organophosphate poisoning
  • DOC – Atropine
  • It is also Known as Hallucinogenic Mushroom poisoning
  • Shows symptoms similar to Atropine poisoning
  • Atropine is C/I
  • Management is purely symptomatic

LESIONS EFFECTS
VAGOTOMY Prolonged inspiration
Transaction in the lower border of the medulla (above C-3) Spontaneous breathing stops

Mid pontine transection Long inspiratory spasms apneustic breathing

questions.text: Rest, Awake, eyes closed, and mind wandering is seen in which wave of EEG?
questions.explanation:
Sleep stage characteristics
EEG EOG Muscle tone Other characteristics
Waking state Alpha waves: high frequency (8-12 Hz), low voltage Rapid, blinking High
Stage N1 (~5%) Less than 50% alpha waves (see above), mixed with slow-wave activity Slow, rolling eye movements High, but gradually dropping Marker for very light quality sleep or sleep disruption
Stage N2 (~50%) K complexes (high voltage negative and positive discharges) with sleep spindles (11-16 Hz) Still High
Stage N3 (Previously 3 and 4)/ slow wave/ Delta sleep (~20%) Delta waves: Low frequency (< 2 Hz), high voltage (> 75 µV) Still Low Homeostatic sleep Reduced BP, HR, cardiac output, RR Growth hormone release
Rapid Eye Movement (REM) Sleep (~25%) Sawtooth waves, mixed frequency, low voltage Rapid eye movement Very low Irregular respiration Arrhythmias, heart rate variation classical dreaming state

questions.text: A 30-year-old male underwent liver transplantation for primary sclerosing cholangitis. Post-transplant, the patient had normal liver parameters. Eight weeks later, the patient presented with abdominal pain and jaundice. His liver function tests were found to be elevated. Biopsy revealed graft rejection. Which of the following statements regarding the rejection of solid organ transplants is true?

options.label: A
options.text: Hyperacute rejection begins in the operating room with reperfusion of the transplanted organ

options.label: B
options.text: Liver transplants are especially susceptible to hyperacute rejection

options.label: C
options.text: Most immunosuppressive medications are used to prevent chronic rejection

options.label: D
options.text: The major cause of graft failure is acute rejection

questions.correct_answer: A. Hyperacute rejection begins in the operating room with reperfusion of the transplanted organ
questions.explanation:
Transplant Rejection
Type Onset Mechanism & Vessel Histology Type of Hypersensitivity
Hyperacute ImmediateMinutes to days Preformed antibodies directed against the donor tissue. Caused by accidental ABO blood type incompatibility which is very rare. Presents while still in surgery with thrombosis and occlusion of graft vessels II
Acute Weeks to months T-cell mediated immune response directed against the foreign MHC. Inflammation and leukocyte infiltration of graft vessels results. Most common type IV
Chronic Months to years T-cell mediated process resulting from the foreign MHC "looking like" a self MHC carrying an antigen. Results in intimal thickening and fibrosis of graft vessels as well as graft atrophy III & IV
Graft vs. Host Varies Donor T-cells in the graft proliferate and attack the recipient's tissue. Most commonly seen in bone marrow transplants. Presents with diarrhoea, rash and jaundice IV

  • Hematogenous spread
  • Microsatellite instability
  • Epidemic

  • APC gene mutations
  • p53, p16 inactivation
  • Familial

  • Women > Men

  • Poorly differentiated signet ring cells
  • Transmural/ Lymphatic spread
  • Endemic
  • Proximal part of stomach
  • Decreased E-cadherin
  • p53, p16 inactivation

questions.correct_answer: B. Supplying circulation to the inferior portion of the interventricular septum

In post pubertal males, spermatogenesis happens every day and about 100 million+ sperms are produced. At which level during this process, does independent assortment of chromosomes occur?
questions.correct_answer: C. Primary spermatocyte to secondary spermatocyte

questions.text: Choroid plexus, made of connective tissue, blood vessels and ependymal cells, produces the CSF.In which of the following components of ventricular system, is choroid plexus present in?
General visceral efferents (GVEs) are fibers under the autonomic nervous system that provide motor innervation via postganglionic varicosities. They do not supply?

All of the following are true about the vagus nerve, except:- Supplies heart and lung Carries post-ganglionic parasympathetic fibers Innervates right 2/3rd of the transverse colon Stimulates peristalsis and relaxes sphincters
Which of the following is Anti-apoptotic gene?

A person working in a nuclear power plant reported to the OPD with enlarged lymph nodes on further examination his blood pictured showed this: Which of the following statement is false about this condition?

options.label: A
options.text: It is not associated with radiation exposure

options.label: B
options.text: It is commonest blood cancer in young

options.label: C
options.text: Investigation of choice is Flow cytometry

options.label: D
options.text: Different stages of maturation of WBC in peripheral smear seen

questions.correct_answer: B. It is commonest blood cancer in young

questions.text: Match the following about gel electrophoresis I. Normal nucleic acids a) Appear as step ladder pattern II. Apoptotic nucleic acids b) Appear as single band III. Necrotic nucleic acids c) Appear as smear pattern
Which type of necrosis is shown in the given image:
Which of the following are features of Paterson-Brown-Kelly syndrome? Esophageal mucosal webs Megaloblastic anemia Glossitis Cheilosis

A chronic smoker with retrosternal chest pain, adult onset coughing and choking. ECG showed sinus rhythm. Cardiologists rule out any cardiac involvement. Endoscopy revealed punched out ulcer and biopsy taken from edge of the ulcer showed multinucleated squamous epithelium cells and eosinophilic Cowdry 'A' inclusions. Name the causative agent for given disease?
questions.explanation:
Various ulcers:
Virus Herpes simplex virus Cytomegalovirus(CMV)
Endoscopy Punched-out ulcers Shallow ulcerations
Biopsy Diagnostic Cowdry A inclusions and multinucleated cells with nuclear melding and ground glass nuclei within a rim of degenerating epithelial cells at the margin of the ulcer. Cytomegalic cells, typically 2-4-fold larger than normal, containing basophilic cytoplasmic & intranuclear inclusion bodies surrounded by a clear halo, giving the appearance of an owl's eye within capillary endothelium & stromal cells
Microscopic

questions.text: Match the following: I. Melanin a) Black coloured urine II. Homogentisic acid b) Derived from Tyrosine III. Hemosiderin c) Brown atrophy IV. Lipofuscin d) Shows Perl’s reaction

35-year-old male came with mucosal bleeding after getting involved in a RTA. Blood panel revealed Platelet count – N PT – N aPTT – elevated BT – elevated Ristocetin assay was positive. What is your diagnosis?

A 2 y/o boy was presented with ataxia, seizures, hypotonia, mental retardation and inappropriate laughter. In examination it is revealed that patient is suffering from Angelman syndrome. What is the pathology in this case?

options.label: A
options.text: Maternal gene is silenced, and paternal gene is functional on 15th chromosome.

options.label: B
options.text: Paternal gene is silenced, and only maternal gene is functional on 15thchromosome.

questions.correct_answer: B. Paternal gene is silenced, and only maternal gene is functional on 15thchromosome.

questions.text: A 60-year-old male, chronic smoker, presented with fatigue and chest pain. On examination, there was inset left eyeball with drooping upper left eyelid and reduced left pupil size. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis in this condition?

options.label: A
options.text: Squamous cell carcinoma involving the apex of his left lung

options.label: C
options.text: A small-cell carcinoma involving the hilum of his left lung

options.label: D
options.text: Bronchioloalveolar carcinoma involving the left lower lobe

questions.correct_answer: A. Squamous cell carcinoma involving the apex of his left lung
questions.explanation:
S Sympathetic Injury
A Anhidrosis
M Miosis
P Ptosis
L Loss of ciliospinal reflex
E Enophthalmos

questions.text: A middle-aged female presented with a 4cm mass in upper outer quadrant of the breast. Biopsy showed densely packed cells within large lakes of mucin. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis of this patient?
Features of Goodpasture syndrome are: Antibody to alpha-3 chain of type IV collagen (COL4A3) Glomerular basement membrane is involved Pulmonary haemorrhage Subendothelial IgG deposits in renal biopsy

A 25-year-old man presents with low grade fever, weight loss, fatigue, crampy abdominal pain, episodic diarrhea & postprandial bloating. Right lower quadrant tenderness is elicited on palpation of abdomen. A capsule endoscopy reveals thickening of terminal ileum, edema, marked luminal narrowing, and a cobblestone appearance of the mucosa. Which of the following is a characteristic of this condition?

options.label: A
options.text: Additional typical findings include crypt abscesses and pseudopolyps.

options.label: B
options.text: Inflammation and ulceration limited to mucosa and submucosa with sparing of deeper layers

options.label: C
options.text: It can affect any portion of the gastrointestinal tract, but proximal jejunum is most common site of involvement.

options.label: D
options.text: It can cause fistula formation between loops of affected bowel.

questions.correct_answer: D. It can cause fistula formation between loops of affected bowel.

questions.text: Patient presents with Parkinson's gait associated with a decline in intellectual functioning (as told by the informant). On examination, the Patient was anxious, difficulty speaking (+), Excessive salivation (+), on examination of eyes following finding is noted. Identify the gene involved in the disease described here:

What is false about osmotic fragility test on RBCs?

options.label: A
options.text: Normal hemolysis starts at 0.5% and stops at 0.3%NaCI.

options.label: B
options.text: In hereditary spherocytosis (HS) osmotic fragility curve shifts to right

options.label: C
options.text: In thalassemia curve shifts to left.

options.label: D
options.text: In HS RBCs swells and rupture at lower concentrations of NaCI.

questions.correct_answer: D. In HS RBCs swells and rupture at lower concentrations of NaCI.
